item.description:
North Carolina Band Brings Music and Film with Vegan Viewpoint
to Historic Hartford Venue

On Friday, May 29th Rock yer Socks in collaboration with the
Charter Oak Cultural Center will host an indie smorgasboard-
indie film, indie music, and indie ideology. The evening begins
at 8pm with a screening of the film, “Seeing Through the Fence”
(run time: 1 hour), followed by three musical acts: Mother
Nevada (NJ), The Kilee (CT), and Beloved Binge (NC). The film
screening/concert will be held at the Charter Oak Cultural
Center and the cost is $6 or only $5 with the donation of a
vegetarian canned good.

The film, created by Beloved Binge drummer Eleni Vlachos (or
Eleni Binge) is a humorous pro-vegan documentary. According to
Mary Jessica Hammes of the Athens-Banner Herald, "Seeing
Through the Fence accomplishes an impressive feat: It's a
documentary about animals, food and veganism that will not only
appeal to omnivores, but actually is quite often funny. It's
not dour and earnest; it's poignant and warm..."

For more information, to listen to these and other local bands, or to
contact RYS please visit www.myspace.com/rockyersocksbooking or
write rockyersocks@gmail.com. For more information on the
Charter Oak Cultural Center (21 Charter Oak Ave, Hartford, CT)
please visit www.charteroakcenter.org or call 860-249-1207.

group.name: The New Haven Vegan Meetup Group

item.name: Rock Yer Socks: Vegan Film
